question: My daughter is eleven.  For the past 3 to 4 yrs, I have noticed a few changes with her.  She started bathing herself early so I didn't notice this earlier.  She has a brown almost dirt color around the back of her neck, underarms, and on the insides of her legs.  I thought she just wasn't washing good in the bath, but it doesn't come off.  She is also a bed wetter, has extreme hunger, excessive thirst, and fatigue.  I recently started making her check her glucose levels so I could keep track.  This was hard for her to do.  Getting better now.  For the past week, her glucose has been anywhere from 140 to 290.  I am assuming that she has juvenille diabetes.  I am a type 2 myself.  I am making her an appt with the pediatrician.  Is all of her symptoms from that?  The discoloration and all?  Is there anyway to lighten it.  It is quite embarrassing for her.  She won't wear sleeveless shirts or even short sleeve if it shows her discoloration.
title: skin discoloration  and juvenille diabetes
